content: If you travel at a constant speed of 60 kilometers per hour, how long will it take to cover a distance of 240 kilometers?

To determine how long it will take to cover a distance of 240 kilometers at a constant speed of 60 kilometers per hour, we can use the formula for time, which is derived from the relationship between distance, speed, and time. The formula is:

\[
\text{time} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}}
\]

Given that the distance is 240 kilometers and the speed is 60 kilometers per hour, we can plug these values into the formula:

\[
\text{time} = \frac{240 \text{ km}}{60 \text{ km/h}}
\]

Now, performing the division:

\[
\text{time} = 4 \text{ hours}
\]

Therefore, it will take 4 hours to cover a distance of 240 kilometers at a constant speed of 60 kilometers per hour.
